intro: Lobelia anceps f. pleniflora, commonly known as the Cape umbrella plant, is a striking South African species characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of blue to purple flowers. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and full sun to partial shade. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy inflorescences bloom in spring and are particularly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
